title: What is the worst book ever written, but famous? - Quora

response.answer_text: Fifty Shades of Grey. Oh my gods, there are so many things wrong with it. How does a senior in college not have her own laptop and email account? Grey is manipulative and creepy well before the “BDSM” stuff comes up. I put BDSM in quotes because THAT is not BDSM, that's straight up abuse. And some of the things Grey says he's done in the past are outright dangerous. Using zip ties as wrist restraints and then leaving the sub tied for hours can cause nerve damage! This book is poorly written, it glamorizes abuse, it makes BDSM in general seem way more messed up than it actually is, and some of the acts mentioned can be downright dangerous.

It’s got to be the first Twilight book. Reading it, the book was slow and boring. There was hardly any action in it and no enticing plot. The characters were pretty deadpan to. All it was is the romanticizing of vampires. Shiny vampires? I don’t get that. How it became popular, is beyond me. I also tried reading the first Hunger Games book but the story of it, the fact that kids have to fight in a game to the death, is a ridiculous plot idea. Both books, I had to put them down when I was halfway through them.

Twilight saga. There is hardly any character development for Bella. We can't feel sympathetic and positive towards central character, so interest decreases . She is shown constantly whining for no reason,making wrong choices ( which affected badly for others) throughout the series. She is shown incredibly selfish and used her parents, Jacob, Mike Newton ,Jessica many times. No sane human jumps from cliff or tries to get gang raped ( and still complains about Jessica ). Love of bells and Edward doesn't seem true as it's based on good looks and good smell, there is hardly any friendship , time or same interests they have to believe their love. If you want good love story of vampire and human, I feel Hotel Transylvania is 10 times better, interesting and emotional too!
The Biggest Typo in Church History Produced the 'Wicked Bible'
Well, “worst ever written” is hard to judge…but I’d really like to see this poorly written, poorly conceived mess off the shelves soon: The Da Vinci Code

Without a doubt, TWILIGHT by Stephanie Meyer. Our book group, all adults, was curious as to why it was so popular with teens, so we read it. 100% agreement on it being the worst book any of us had ever read - bad writing, poor character development, you name it. Granted, it’s a book written for teens, but so are the Harry Potter books, and they are all heads and tails above Meyer’s works.

“The Da Vinci Code.” When the Da Vinci came out, I bought a copy just to see that the fuss was about. I gave it away (I skimmed through it) later, because “I’ve read it already.” Strange thing to do for a book collector.

“Lincoln in the Bardo” by George Saunders won the Mann Booker Prize, and is one of the worst books I have ever tried to read. But hey, surely the publishers wouldn’t hype a dud so much just for a few million bucks: Would they?
pride and prejudice  by jane austen.....

There are a lot of over rated books but one that comes to mind is Chetan Bhagat’s Half Girlfriend which was literally a punishment for readers. Another was J K Rowling’s The Casual Vacancy- the book was so long, drab and dreary, I never completed it. This was a huge disappointment because I have a long love affair with the Harry Potter series and I felt let down by the book.
The Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling. Water for Elephants by Sarah Gruen
